definitions.definition: To burn the flesh with a hot iron, either as a marker (for criminals, slaves etc.) or to cauterise a wound.
examples: When they caught him, he was branded and then locked up.

subdefinitions.definition: To mark (especially cattle) with a brand as proof of ownership .
examples: The ranch hands had to brand every new calf by lunchtime.

definitions.definition: To make an indelible impression on the memory or senses.
examples: Her face is branded upon my memory.
He was branded a fool by everyone that heard his story.

definitions.definition: To associate a product or service with a trademark or other name and related images.
examples: They branded the new detergent "Suds-O", with a nature scene inside a green O on the muted-colored recycled-cardboard box.

definitions.definition: To be very hot , to burn .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To burn the flesh with a hot iron, either as a marker (for criminals, slaves etc.) or to cauterise a wound.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To make an indelible impression on the memory or senses.
( transitive , marketing ) To associate a product or service with a trademark or other name and related images.
( intransitive ) To be very hot , to burn .
